channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: CNN has endured turmoil for years. With Warner Bros. sale, things will get bumpier
item.description: In the corporate battle over parent company Warner Bros. Discovery, CNN's fate remains up for grabs. President Trump wants a say in what happens next.
item.content:encoded:
In the corporate battle over parent company Warner Bros. Discovery, CNN's fate remains up for grabs. President Trump wants a say in what happens next.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/AP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from ICE custody. And, Indiana rejects redistricting
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man the Trump administration mistakenly deported in March and eventually returned, is now free from ICE custody. And, Indiana lawmakers reject a redistricting proposal.
item.content:encoded:
Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man the Trump administration mistakenly deported in March and eventually returned, is now free from ICE custody. And, Indiana lawmakers reject a redistricting proposal.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Amputees often feel disconnected from their bionic hands. AI could bridge the gap
item.description: Sensors and artificial intelligence help a prosthetic hand act more like a natural one, new research shows.
item.content:encoded:
Sensors and artificial intelligence help a prosthetic hand act more like a natural one, new research shows.

(Image credit: Dave Titensor)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Trump touts his peace deals - but many are already unraveling
item.description: President Trump has been racing to rack up peace deals — but keeping them intact is proving far more difficult.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has been racing to rack up peace deals — but keeping them intact is proving far more difficult.

(Image credit: Patrick Smith)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Thailand's Parliament is dissolved for new elections early next year
item.description: Thailand's Parliament was dissolved Friday for new elections early next year as the country engaged in deadly fighting with Cambodia.
item.content:encoded:
Thailand's Parliament was dissolved Friday for new elections early next year as the country engaged in deadly fighting with Cambodia.

(Image credit: Arnun Chonmahatrakool)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: For 50 years, Rockalina the turtle lived on a kitchen floor. Now she has a new friend
item.description: The Oreo-sized baby turtle represents a turning point in Rockalina's recovery: Spending time with her own kind.
item.content:encoded:
The Oreo-sized baby turtle represents a turning point in Rockalina's recovery: Spending time with her own kind.

(Image credit: Garden State Tortoise)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: U.S. military members fear personal legal blowback tied to boat strikes
item.description: Staff officers and at least one drone pilot have sought advice from outside groups over legal concerns about their own involvement — or potential involvement — in the strikes against suspected drug boats.
item.content:encoded:
Staff officers and at least one drone pilot have sought advice from outside groups over legal concerns about their own involvement — or potential involvement — in the strikes against suspected drug boats.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Trump struggles to find his economic messaging amid voter skepticism
item.description: Nearly a year into his second term, President Trump is facing growing skepticism as Americans feel persistent cost-of-living pressures despite his efforts to defend the strength of the economy.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly a year into his second term, President Trump is facing growing skepticism as Americans feel persistent cost-of-living pressures despite his efforts to defend the strength of the economy.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: History-making male flight attendant says job taught him to 'always rise to the top'
item.description: Darrell Anderson became the first male flight attendant for Frontier Airlines in the 1970s, a time when the role was predominantly female. He talks about the experience with a former colleague.
item.content:encoded: Darrell Anderson became the first male flight attendant for Frontier Airlines in the 1970s, a time when the role was predominantly female. He talks about the experience with a former colleague.
item.dc:creator: Esther Honig

item.title: What's on your TikTok page? U.S. looks to scour tourists' online profiles
item.description: Foreign visitors who are eligible to bypass the visa application process may soon have to turn over five years' worth of social media history to enter the U.S., under a new Trump administration plan.
item.content:encoded:
Foreign visitors who are eligible to bypass the visa application process may soon have to turn over five years' worth of social media history to enter the U.S., under a new Trump administration plan.

(Image credit: Julie Jacobson)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo
